value.halfverse: for he hath visited and redeemed his people;
value.verse: Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, *

value.halfverse: in the house of his servant David,
value.verse: And hath raised up a mighty salvation for us *
As he spake by the mouth of his holy prophets, *
value.halfverse: which have been since the world began:
and from the hand of all that hate us;
value.verse: That we should be saved from our enemies, *
To perform the mercy promised to our forefathers, *
value.halfverse: and to remember his holy covenant;

value.verse: To perform the oath which he sware to our forefather Abraham, *
That we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies *
In holiness and righteousness before him, *
value.halfverse: all the days of our life.
for thou shalt go before the face of the Lord to prepare his ways;
value.verse: And thou, child, shalt be called the prophet of the Highest, *
To give knowledge of salvation unto his people *
value.halfverse: for the remission of their sins,
whereby the dayspring from on high hath visited us;
value.verse: Through the tender mercy of our God, *

value.halfverse: and to guide our feet into the way of peace.
value.verse:
To give light to them that sit in darkness
and in the shadow of death, *
